theory_assignments.reasoning: This theory centers on mTOR-driven continuation of developmental growth causing cellular hyperfunction and geroconversion, a core mTOR hyperfunction mechanism.
Focuses on mTOR nutrient sensing as central aging driver and rapamycin inhibition extending lifespan, fitting the mTOR hyperfunction and geroconversion theme.
Describes phosphate-induced activation of Akt/mTORC1 causing hyperfunction, oxidative damage, and aging, directly implicating mTOR hyperfunction mechanisms.
Explains aging as quasi-programmed continuation of growth via mTOR causing hyperfunction and senescence, core to mTOR hyperfunction theory.
Focuses on TORC1 as central lifespan regulator with multiple signaling inputs, and lifespan extension via TORC1 inhibition, fitting mTOR hyperfunction theme.
Describes mTOR nutrient sensing regulating translation and anabolic processes affecting longevity and reproduction, fitting mTOR hyperfunction mechanisms.
Details mTOR anabolic/catabolic balance disruption causing aging and senescence, with mTOR inhibition extending lifespan, core to mTOR hyperfunction.
Describes TOR as conserved nutrient-responsive aging regulator with lifespan extension via TOR reduction, fitting mTOR hyperfunction and geroconversion.
Focuses on TOR as senescence-promoting gene driving geroconversion and aging, with lifespan extension by TOR inhibition, fitting mTOR hyperfunction theme.
Links mTOR nutrient sensing to aging and neuroprotection, with mTOR inhibition extending lifespan, consistent with mTOR hyperfunction mechanisms.
Describes aging as harmful continuation of developmental programs driven by mTOR hyperactivity causing senescence, fitting mTOR hyperfunction theory.
Focuses on mTOR-driven aging and cancer via geroconversion and hyperfunction, with rapalogs inhibiting mTOR to slow aging, fitting mTOR hyperfunction theme.
Details mTORC1 hyperactivation causing cardiac aging and dysfunction, with inhibition rejuvenating cardiac function, fitting mTOR hyperfunction mechanisms.
Describes mTOR nutrient sensing promoting geroconversion and cellular senescence, with chronic activation causing dysfunction and inhibition extending lifespan.
Focuses on mTOR-driven hyperfunctional aging causing insulin resistance and metabolic dysregulation, with mTOR inhibition extending lifespan, core mTOR hyperfunction.
Proposes aging as continuation of developmental programs via Tor hyperactivation causing hyperfunction and pathology, with inhibition extending lifespan.
Describes mTOR inhibition by rapamycin and dietary restriction reducing protein synthesis and increasing autophagy, extending lifespan via mTOR hyperfunction mechanisms.
Focuses on Maf1 as mTOR effector regulating lifespan via Pol III transcription repression, linking nutrient sensing and aging, fitting mTOR hyperfunction theme.
Describes pharmacological mTOR inhibition extending lifespan and delaying age-related diseases, consistent with mTOR hyperfunction and geroconversion theory.
Details geroconversion driven by mTORC1/C2 complexes and potential anti-aging effects of dual inhibitors, fitting mTOR hyperfunction and senescence mechanisms.
Focuses on rapamycin inhibition of mTORC1 delaying aging and extending healthspan in multiple species, consistent with mTOR hyperfunction theory.
Emphasizes aging as run-on of developmental and reproductive programs causing senescent pathologies via antagonistic pleiotropy, a distinct quasi-program hyperfunction theme.
Describes calorie restriction decelerating mTOR-driven aging by suppressing hyperfunction and insulin resistance, fitting mTOR hyperfunction mechanisms.
Focuses on growth-driven ROS generation accelerating aging and immune activation, linking growth hyperfunction to oxidative damage distinct from pure mTOR signaling.
Describes Maf1 as mTOR-regulated repressor of Pol III transcription affecting genomic integrity and lifespan, fitting mTOR hyperfunction and nutrient sensing theme.
Details mTOR inhibition extending lifespan in C. elegans with dose and timing effects, supporting mTOR hyperfunction as causal aging mechanism.
Focuses on mTORC1 integrating metabolic and stress signals affecting aging hallmarks and stress granule formation, fitting mTOR hyperfunction and cellular senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: mTOR and AMPK Core Longevity Pathways Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Combines mTOR inhibition and AMPK activation as central, interacting longevity pathways, representing a distinct mechanistic subcluster focused on energy sensing balance.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: mTOR Complexes Balance in Reproductive Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on balance of mTORC1 and mTORC2 regulating sperm epigenetic aging and blood-testis barrier integrity, a distinct mTOR hyperfunction subcluster related to reproductive aging.
